main event: On 5 March 1948, two objects resembling falling aircraft were observed in Bakersfield, California, trailing black and red smoke.
interesting points: The objects were seen by multiple witnesses, including a civilian and personnel from local agencies., The incident occurred between 1510 and 1555 GMT., The number of confirmed sightings at the same location over a few days casts doubt on the explanation of a disintegrating meteorite., Witnesses reported a parachute-like object seen after the main objects, suggesting more than just a meteorite., The official investigation indicated no successful recovery of the objects despite extensive searches.
sighted object: two objects on fire, resembling aircraft
witness description: male civilians and local agency personnel
